July 7, 2025: All good things come in 3’s this month (or rather, 2x3). All three co-supervised master students successfully submitted their theses, and I’m quite impressed by the final write-ups. As everyone expressed publication interest we’ll see how to materialize their work further. In addition, I’ve co-authored three projects that will be presented at Uncertainty in AI in Rio de Janeiro! This is in two weeks already, so we’re off again on travels. Our works address risk monitoring via sequential testing, using geometry for conformal prediction, and some preliminary work on equivariant model selection. Great teamwork with Rajeev and Putri, and really fun to branch out into new domains and take interesting perspectives on existing problems. Of course, always with an eye for statistical rigour ;-)
